ray.rage.rendersystem.states

Interface RenderState

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FrontFaceState, TextureState, ZBufferState
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL4AbstractRenderState, GL4FrontFaceState, GL4TextureState, GL4ZBufferState

    public interface RenderState
extends Disposable
    A render state has information about settings that should be applied to the underlying graphics driver in use by the render-system implementation.

    Render states are meant to modify the underlying settings, or "configuration", of the render-system, such as enabling or disabling functionality to allow specific renderables to be processed as intended (e.g. depth tests, front faces).

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RenderState.Type
      The type of state that a particular instance may apply.
